title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
OB: No children node is listed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement.
2. Make sure the new data source does not have any database/table/column information.
3. Observe that there are no children nodes listed when changing the data source for the data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
4. Close the data set editor and reopen it.
